definition: to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: They contributed a lot to the development of the art of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 无题诗对诗歌艺术的发展贡献很大。

sentences.english: For more information see the dust loose old walls, and death poem dash of people.
sentences.chinese: 欲知松老看尘壁，死却题诗几许人。

sentences.english: The novels written by "Poems on Red Leaf" in the Tang & Five Dynasties have long enjoyed popularity since their emergence.
sentences.chinese: 唐五代“红叶题诗”小说自它产生之日起便盛传不衰。

sentences.english: Taste for bamboo, a poem to express his and all Jiamiao.
sentences.chinese: 尝作墨竹，题诗寄意，并皆佳妙。

definition: verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律
extemporaneous thoughts noted down after a visit
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to respond to a poem with a poem
couplet (hung on the columns of a hall)
